question: Question_02_(b)
statement:
The boundary value problem

\begin{align*}
&f''(x) + xf(x) = 1, \quad 0 < x < 1 \\
&f(0) = 1, \quad f'(1) = 1\end{align*}

can be approximated by an \emph{(N + 1) x (N + 1)} system of linear
equations of the form

\begin{align*}(L + (\Delta x)^2Q)\mathbf{F} = \mathbf{b}\end{align*}

\textbf{(b)} How would you use MATLAB/Octave to compute approximations
to $\displaystyle f(1/2)$ and $\displaystyle f'(1/2)$? Assume that
\emph{N} has been defined and write code that uses this value of
\emph{N}.

dx = 1/N

L = 1/dx\textsuperscript{2}*{[}{[}dx\textsuperscript{2} 0 0 0{]};
diag(ones(3),-1) + diag(-2*ones(3)) + diag(ones(3),1); {[}0 0 -dx
dx{]}{]}

for m = 1:N

qVector(m) = m-1

end

qVector(N+1) = 0

Q = 1/dx*diag(qVector)

f = (L + dx\textsuperscript{2}*Q)
